text: Breaking news: 3 Gear S devices. On my desk. IRL.
OMG
"my desk" = a little desk over in the west wing

<@U0260V1BX>: Im not sure if you still want to check it out, but I brought my running watch in today. I think there are probably better options (mine is pretty old), but you're welcome to it. For what it's worth, I'd check out the Garmin Forerunner 620 - it has one of the nicer screens (and better visualizations) in the category
also - this video will give you some info on the startup/GPS/tracking sequence
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_kYU_tKDJa8#t=25>

attachments.title: Garmin FR620 Satellite Lock with Precaching
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Garmin FR620 Satellite Lock with Precaching

text: <@U0260V4K1> thanks i would like to take a look at it!
fyi, the Waygo translation app keeps translating most of the screens to "connect noodles"
those crazy koreans
and their noodles
New translation method: following along with Flossy Carter's unboxing video. <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jech_Bvb7E0>
Friends, I've grabbed the big conference room for our UX meeting/party
ugh, I am getting that signature invalid error in my tizen IDE when I try to launch apps on the gear s
Oof. I was worried about that happening

I generated a certificate but I'm missing the documentation related to signing certificates for wearables... it's odd how difficult this is (and I wonder why I didn't go through this with the other Gear when I first set up the IDE)
I think when the Android build was on there it was subject to the same nonsense
in the developer forums, people are encountering this a lot and it seems to have many different causes, none of which are actually problems with the certificate but problems in Tizen or the IDE
I think I'm on the right track now... if someone could check <mailto:test@uncorkedstudios.com|test@uncorkedstudios.com>, a certificate should be on the way in a few minutes
Silly me, I was using the "Tizen IDE" and not "Tizen for Wearable IDE", which has all the certificate tools and documentation
In particular I need author.crt and device-profile.xml files from Samsung
FINALLY got it working, I can now install signed apps on the white gear S
I'll need to repeat a request process for the other devices before they can receive installs, whenever you're ready
YES!
Sort of
Melissa brought one of the black ones and I sent the request, should be coming in to test@
It's such a convoluted process, I'm not sure I can even explain it, but I can implement it
I'm about to head out for today, Melissa's black device is all prepared for installs, and I put all the devices+phones in the white drawers under the roll of checker paper
Perfect. Thanks!
